simple.escp.dom

Class Report

  • java.lang.Object
    • simple.escp.dom.Report
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Iterable<Page>

    public class Report
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Iterable<Page>
    DOM class to represent a print result in form of collection of empty, one or more Page. Report is usually the output of parsing stage. To initiate filling stage, call fill() method of this class.

        public TextLine[] copyHeader()

        Returns:
        the copy of current header.

        Returns:

        public Page getPage(int pageNumber)
        Get a Page based on its pageNumber.
        Parameters:
        pageNumber - the page number for the page that will be retrieved.
        Returns:
        a Page or throws IllegalArgumentException if pageNumber is not valid.

      • getFirstPageWithTableLines

        public Page getFirstPageWithTableLines()
        Get the first Page in this report that has TableLine.
        Returns:
        a Page that has at least one TableLine, or null if no page in this report has TableLine.

      • newPage

        public Page newPage(boolean plain)
        Create a new page for this report.
        Parameters:
        plain - if true will ignore header and footer. Set this to false to create a Page that doesn't have header and footer.
        Returns:
        the created Page.

      • newPage

        public Page newPage(boolean plain,
           int startAtLineNumber)
        Create a new page for this report that start at specified line. The line before the specified line will be filled by an EmptyLine.
        Parameters:
        plain - if true will ignore header and footer. Set this to false to create a Page that doesn't have header and footer.
        startAtLineNumber - start appending from this line number and ignore lines before this line number.
        Returns:
        the created Page.

      • lineBreak

        public void lineBreak()
        Start a line break. The next call of append() will create a new page and write to this new page instead of current page.

      • appendSinglePage

        public Page appendSinglePage(java.util.List<Line> content,
                    boolean plain)
        Add a new single page to the last page of this report.
        Parameters:
        content - the content of the page.
        plain - set true to include header and footer, or false if otherwise.
        Returns:
        the created Page.

      • appendSinglePage

        public Page appendSinglePage(Line[] content,
                    boolean plain)
        Add a new single page to the last page of this report.
        Parameters:
        content - the content of the page.
        plain - set true to include header and footer, or false if otherwise.
        Returns:
        the created Page.

      • append

        public void append(Line line,
          boolean plain)
        Add a new line to this report. If current page is full, this method will create a new page and write to the new page.
        Parameters:
        line - a new line to be inserted to the last page of this report.
        plain - set true to include header and footer, or false if otherwise.

      • insert

        public void insert(Line line,
          int pageNumber,
          int lineNumber,
          java.util.List<? extends Line> newPageFirstLines)
        Insert a new line at certain page and certain position. This may causes a new page to be created if necessary.
        Parameters:
        line - a new line to be inserted to this report.
        pageNumber - the page number in which the new line will be inserted.
        lineNumber - the line number in the page where the new line will be inserted.
        newPageFirstLines - these lines will be added to the new page if this insertion creates new page.

      • insert

        public void insert(Line line,
          int pageNumber,
          int lineNumber)
        Insert a new line at certain page and certain position. This may causes a new page to be created if necessary.
        Parameters:
        line - a new line to be inserted to this report.
        pageNumber - the page number in which the new line will be inserted.
        lineNumber - the line number in the page where the new line will be inserted.

      • hasDynamicLine

        public boolean hasDynamicLine()
        Determine if one or more pages in this report has one or more dynamic lines.
        Returns:
        true if this report contains dynamic line or false if otherwise.

      • getFlatLines

        public java.util.List<Line> getFlatLines()
        Get all lines in this report combined as one big page. EmptyLine will be ignored.
        Returns:
        all lines in this report.

      • getContentLinesPerPage

        public int getContentLinesPerPage()
        Get the length of content for each page. Content is the area within the page that doesn't include header and footer. Methods such as append(Line, boolean) or insert(Line, int, int) works only within this area.
        Returns:
        the length of content page in number of lines.

      • getStartOfFooter

        public int getStartOfFooter()
        Get line number that indicates the first line of footer.
        Returns:
        line number for the first line of footer. If this report doesn't have footer, the returned value is line number for the last line.
